intro: Odontadenia sprucei, commonly known as the mountain devil, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves, which help it conserve water in arid environments. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. It is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils, preferring full sun exposure. Odontadenia sprucei is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that is well adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat.
